title: How do white sweet potatoes and orange sweet potatoes differ? - Quora

response.answer_text: First of all, their skin color. They both mostly range from a golden color to an almost-reddish color.   Purple sweet potatoes contain the most antitoxins, but since they are hard to find, the orange ones win over the white ones. The orange potatoes contain more beta-carotene which your body turns into vitamin A.

Your question isn’t specific enough. Are you talking about Murasaki, or just white? Murasaki is one of the sweetest potatoes out there. The only competitor it has is the Okinawan Purple sweet potato, that is both healthy and really sweet. It really comes down to preference. In my experience, orange potatoes had more syrup in it, white was not as sweet, while Murasaki and Okinawan blew both of them away.
